1636134204_12rAw78P4EdKZWbBv2t3VYRFMiJEa.body:
> [styromaniac@kxoid.bit](#comment_196_1PxcegJ1mKoMHeS73f9MvXeUWDq8BdnSv3): Protonmail cannot be trusted. They'll rat you out. [...]

the `only` information they can give is the IP and possible the two step information (SMS verification) they cannot access the email contents which lets face is where 99.9% of the incriminating information lies.

If this where gmail/outlook not only would they have the IP but the contents of all emails, buying habits, movments information (android tracking), YouTube watch history, browser history,

basically every place you have ever visited, every website, basically your whole life. 

lets not make the mistake of a mixing company in with the others who able to give out an IP address vs other providers that will lay out your whole life from any warrant no matter how vague.

protonmail is a cut above the rest in terms of privacy.

actually they were named Coronavirus after their distinctive morphological appearance. It has nothing to with transport methods.

The common cold is caused by a number of virus

rhinovirus (30–80%),  human coronaviruses (≈ 15%), influenza viruses (10–15%), adenoviruses (5%)
